definition: snow/snowfall/CL:場|场[chang2]/to have the appearance of snow/to wipe away, off or out/to clean

sentences.english: Turning in adaptive snowshoeing requires a simple angling of the foot.
sentences.chinese: 在自适应转向雪鞋的脚需要一个简单的钓鱼。

sentences.english: Without hesitation, she strapped on a pair of snowshoes and headed out into the snow.
sentences.chinese: 她没有半点迟疑，就绑紧雪鞋走进雪里。

sentences.english: They often wear snowshoes to make the ascent easier.
sentences.chinese: 为了攀爬容易，常常会穿着雪鞋。

sentences.english: Equipment for adaptive snowshoeing should fit properly to avoid injury.
sentences.chinese: 雪鞋的自适应设备应符合正确，以免受伤。

sentences.english: Adaptive snowshoeing is great for people to get exercise and some fresh air.
sentences.chinese: 自适应雪鞋是伟大的人民得到锻炼和一些新鲜空气。

sentences.english: Here are a few pointers to make your first snowshoeing trip go as smoothly as possible.
sentences.chinese: 这里有几点，使你的第一个雪鞋行去尽可能顺利进行。

sentences.english: It feels so fantastic when I fly in my skiing shoes in the carpet of white.
sentences.chinese: 当我穿着滑雪鞋在银白的地毯上飞舞时，感觉太棒了。

sentences.english: Warm up before snowshoeing to avoid pulling muscles.
sentences.chinese: 雪鞋前热身，以避免肌肉拉。

sentences.english: One of my snowshoes got caught on a rock.
sentences.chinese: 我的一只雪鞋绊在石头上了。

sentences.english: Get into an athletic stance when snowshoeing to stretch a number of different muscles.
sentences.chinese: 到时得到的雪鞋运动姿态伸展的肌肉数量的不同。

sentences.english: Snowshoeing trails may also be available in parks.
sentences.chinese: 雪鞋路径也可以在公园里。
